Description: Typical range for industrial 1064 nm fiber lasers cleaning hard ceramics like B4C; starting at 100 W balances efficiency and safety to avoid thermal damage given B4C's low thermal conductivity (~30 W/m·K); max limited to prevent melting (mp ~2450°C). Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and laser cleaning studies on ceramics (e.g., J. Laser Appl. 2018).
Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution
Pulse frequency for controlled material removal
Pulse duration for minimal thermal penetration
Beam travel speed for uniform coverage
Number of cleaning cycles for complete removal
Beam overlap for consistent surface treatment
